ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This class will give you a better sense of how business operates, how ethics play into that question, and how to think academically!

I developed a great understanding of South African history and various business case studies related to it. Going forward into whatever career I choose, I feel like my insights and skills from these case studies will be extremely important as I look to make the right decision.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This is a great course that could have likely used more students in it!

This class had several strengths. First and foremost, Prof Makgetla was extremely engaging, thoughtful, and knowledgable. She gave extremely clear feedback and frequently checked in with students to make sure our class experience was going well. I also loved the course material including the weekly case studies. I really liked how this class merged theory with practice, as readings each week allowed simultaneous study of theoretical perspectives and more realistic scenarios in which they applied. I also liked how each class was contextualized with an email prior to class discussing the readings and a few sides at the beginning of class. No weaknesses!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Tumi was SO great about getting feedback from us/making the course engaging despite the virtual format!
I thought the class ran smoothly given the circumstances. We began to use breakout sessions later in the course which was a nice way to meet fellow classmates and further develop thoughts.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! I learned so much about South Africa in a great classroom environment!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We screened a documentary and used case materials in preparation for class.

extras.title:
